text:
I am in an environment where port 1099 is being used by some other application 
(not rmiregistry) and I haven't figured out a way to use an alternate port that 
Jmeter can use.

I tried:
1) on the client side it is easy to change the port,  just include the port 
with the host for remote clients
2) on the server side (remote client side) I did not find any coinfiguration 
for the rmi port. Tried chaning the rmi port with some java command line 
options and that did not help.  Upon looking at source code,  it seems that in 
the server mode,  jmeter does not use the port information,  it just tries to 
register/query the localhost (at default port)with the rmiregistry.
creator: sanjai_bhargava@hotmail.com

text:
Added property server.rmi.port which can be specified on command-line when
starting JMeter, e.g.


 rmiregistry 1100

....

 jmeter -s -Jserver.rmi.port=1100

This will be in JMeter 2.1
creator: sebb@apache.org

text:
